fields.body: Is anything more fun than dancing? With a friend or alone, turn up the music and take a spin around your living room!
Space around your office building looking a little trashy? How about picking up 5 pieces of litter before heading in to do some good and get a few steps?
Heard of letterboxing? Look online! There are "treasure hunts" hidden in local parks - you could spend an hour today solving one!
Just a reminder that you rock! How about thanking your body for all that it does by standing up and giving it a big stretch?
Quick, look at the clock! If the hour is odd, do that many toe-touches: stand - reach to ceiling - reach to toes - repeat.
How about a picnic? Pack lunch or grab a snack & head to a nearby park for a short walk followed by some relaxation!
This evening would be a good time for a challenge: a walk in bad weather. Bundle up & enjoy the outdoors!
How about taking the stairs this morning? On the ground floor? Take a lap around your floor before returning to your work.
Weather won't always cooperate with good intentions. Do you have a walking backup plan? How about finding a treadmill & taking a 15 minute walk?
Out-and-about? Whatever you're doing, try to add steps. At the game? Stroll around the stadium. At a café? Walk while you sip.
When's the last time you ran? It can be intimidating for new runners, but an alternating run-walk now would be a great workout.
When's the last time you ran? It can be intimidating for new runners, but an alternating run-walk now would be a great workout.
Here's a great weekend morning tradition: a family (or friend, or pet) walk! You can start today--grab a loved one and go!
Fresh air has been shown to increase productivity! How about walking to work (even partway!) & getting some fresh air today?
At a desk? Stretch your feet! Lift heels & press toes into the ground for 10 seconds. Then switch--heels on the ground & toes up.
Think of your colleagues: Who might provide a new perspective or idea for a project? Can you walk over and chat with them?
Can you replace your coffee break with a walk? You'll reap the same energizing rewards, but with cardiovascular benefits to boot!
Does your office have stairs? Try starting at the bottom and climbing to the top--or as far as you can. A great, short workout!
While eating at your desk can be tempting, lunch is your time for a much-needed mental break. Can you take a few minutes to stand & stretch?
Have you borrowed something - a book or stapler - that you've been meaning to return? How about walking it over to your coworker now?
Are your arms tight? Try arm circles: stand straight, extend arms to the sides, and make big circles forwards and backwards.
Are you antsy? Grab something heavy (a book or bag) & lift to the ceiling 10 times. Then keep the blood flowing with 500 steps!
Is there a museum, event, or flea market you could visit today? Even strolling through the mall can add an easy 1,000 steps!
Your body needs hydration. Why don't you head to the kitchen for a glass of water? Set a goal of finishing it in the next hour.
Ordering in tonight? Why not search online for a healthy recipe instead? You can get in some steps while you cook!
Gloomy weather today? Even wandering through your house can add steps. Maybe you'll find something you've been looking for!
Gloomy weather today? Even wandering through your house can add steps. Maybe you'll find something you've been looking for!
Have a long conference call today? Walking in place or pacing while you talk can keep you engaged and increase your step count!
There's no better way to spend a weekend evening than taking a walk around the neighborhood! Are you up for it?
Heard of walking conference calls? Use a cell phone & walk outside or in the halls during your call. Productive and healthy!
Don't forget to take a break! A 10-15 minute walk, whether outside or around your office building, can help combat fatigue.
Taken a walk break yet? Just remember: a 5-minute stroll now can mean more energy all afternoon!
Thomas Jefferson said, "Habituate yourself to walk very far." We say, it doesn't have to be far--just try to walk every day.
Have you been staring at a screen all day? Give your eyes a break by walking around your house or block for the next 3-5 minutes.
Have you been staring at a screen all day? Give your eyes a break by walking around your office for the next 3-5 minutes.
The weather can be unpredictable, but you KNOW you'll feel better after a walk! Can you brave whatever's outside for 10 minutes?
The weather can be unpredictable, but you KNOW you'll feel better after a walk! Can you brave whatever's outside for 10 minutes?
Sometimes the morning air can be more invigorating than hot coffee! Take a 10-minute walk this morning & let nature wake you up.
How about scheduling a 'walking meeting' with a colleague? You can discuss strategies for success & increase your step count!
Your arms need stretching, too! Stand and reach one arm across your body, pulling with your other arm. Repeat on the other side.
What about hiding the remote tonight? Adjusting the channel and volume manually keep you moving (just a bit!) while you relax.
Feeling lethargic? Expending energy can actually increase alertness! How about seeing how you feel after a 10-minute walk?
Feeling lethargic? Expending energy can actually increase alertness! How about seeing how you feel after a 10-minute walk?
Waiting for the toaster to pop or water to boil? Multi-task! Jog in place, stretch, or do push-ups against the counter.
Feeling lethargic? Expending energy can actually increase alertness! Why don't you see how you feel after a 10-minute walk?
Walking in the snow can be refreshing! Could you take a walk to get some "me-time" in?
Walking in the snow at night can be magical--could you take a walk to get some meditative "me-time" in?
Tonight, what if you swap 30 minutes of TV for a 30-min walk? Or, if your favorite show is on, walk in place during commercials!
What a morning! How about treating yourself to some beautiful sights by taking a short walk before work?
How about upping your activity while cooking dinner? Maybe dance as you stir or do squats while the water heats up!
Planning to watch TV tonight? Make sure that you stand up and stretch your legs regularly (maybe during each commercial break!).
Is there someone you want to call? Maybe a loved one or a far-away friend? Give them a call and walk while you talk!
Staying in for the night? If you're feeling sentimental, take a walk through your house & reminisce about every framed picture!
You could brave this blustery weather with a quick walk around the block. Woo! It makes you know you're alive, doesn't it?
Strength is as important as physical activity! Tonight, could you find 5 core, leg, or arm exercises online to try?
Strength is as important as physical activity! Tonight, could you find 5 core, leg, or arm exercises online to try?
If your body could talk, would it tell you that it's tired of sitting? How about working while standing for a few minutes?
Taking the bus home? How about walking to a bus stop a few blocks further away & starting your evening with a bit of fresh air?
Longer routes = more steps! How might you add steps during your lunch hour today?
Longer routes = more steps! How might you add steps when you're on break or as you head to the restroom today?
In the mood to do good? Head to the park with a small trash bag & set a goal of picking up 10 pieces of trash during your walk!
In the mood to do good? Head to the park with a small trash bag & set a goal of picking up 10 pieces of trash during your walk!
Feeling thirsty? That's your body's way of telling you you're dehydrated. Why don't you head to the kitchen for a glass of water?
Tonight, why not try a few stretches or yoga poses? You can find beginner poses online - might we suggest Child's Pose?
How lucky you are to have a strong, healthy body that can carry you so far! How about giving it a little TLC with a 10-min walk?
Need a coffee break? How about a walk to a nearby coffee shop? If you have extra time, maybe you could pick one farther away.
A lower-leg exercise you can do at your desk: rotate your right foot clockwise 15 times, then counterclockwise. Repeat with left foot.
It’s important to hydrate. If you walk to the water fountain now, you can refill your bottle while also stretching your legs!
Don't let the snow stop you! Why don't you stop at the mall, gym, or superstore on the way home & walk for 2000 steps?
Go old-school today: forget email, phone, and instant messenger. Walk to your colleagues & talk face-to-face (You'll add steps!).
Go old-school this afternoon: forget email, phone, and instant messenger. Walk to your colleagues & talk face-to-face. (You'll add steps!)
How about taking a break and walking outside to clear your head? You'll be more productive when you come back.
Bad weather can be a drag, but even small bouts of movement can improve energy levels. How about taking the stairs today for an energy boost?
30-min of walking can have many health benefits, including reducing the risk of osteoporosis & some cancers. How about 15-min now & 15-min later?
Can you take a 5 minute break? Even 5 minutes of walking can significantly improve health. Our bodies are made to move!
Did you know that weekend afternoons are the most popular times for walks? Can you join the trend & enjoy a walk today?
When's the last time you dusted? If you have 5 minutes, you could grab a feather duster & take a crack at those end tables!
Good morning! How about starting the day with a 15-minute walk? Or if not now, maybe a walk between morning meetings?
Walking could help organize your thoughts & get the creative juices flowing. What problem could you solve during a short walk?
Busy weekend? Reward yourself with a walk. Long or short - they all help!
Bad weather sometimes requires creative activity. How about walking the stairs at your office this morning?
Bad weather won't deter you from achieving your goal! Can you make time for 500 extra steps both in the office & at home today?
When was the last time you said hi to your neighbors? How about a quick walk around the block to see if anyone's outside?
When was the last time you said hi to your neighbors? How about a quick walk around the block to see if anyone's outside?
Feeling thirsty? You might already be dehydrated. Help your body out by finding a fountain or getting a glass of water!
It's tempting to work through lunch, but your body & mind need a break. Is there a break room or common area where you can eat?
You know that email you need to send to your coworker down the hall? What if you deliver your message in person instead?
More bad weather?! Luckily, mall walking was invented for days like today! How about getting in 1000 steps before heading home?
Don't let the bad weather get you down! Could walking a few flights of stairs during lunch be the pick-me-up you need?
What stories have you been meaning to share? How about taking a walk with a loved one or friend to tell your tales?
There are about 2,000 steps in a mile. How many miles will YOU walk today? Could you start with just 500 extra steps before work?
Have kids? Friends' kids? A pet? If you run around with a child or furry friend today, you'll move more without realizing it!
Have kids? Friends' kids? A pet? If you run around with a child or furry friend today, you'll move more without realizing it!
Change up your movement! How about doing 5 minutes of walking lunges around your house? It will stretch your legs & raise your heart rate!
Time to get the blood flowing! Try walking to a bathroom or fountain a bit farther away from your desk to get extra steps in.
How can you get more steps on busy days? How about taking a restroom break & fitting in 500 extra steps?
How can you get more steps on busy days? How about scheduling a walking meeting for this afternoon?
How can you get more steps on busy days? How about taking the stairs instead of the elevator all afternoon?
How can you get more steps on busy days? How about taking the stairs instead of the elevator all morning?
Do you like random acts of kindness? Tonight you could cook a healthy meal & walk the extras to a neighbor!
How could you get 500 steps right now? Walk up & down your stairs for 5 minutes? Walk the perimeter of your house a few times?
How could you add activity to tonight's commute? Could you get off the bus a stop early, or stop at a park for a quick stroll?
If your work day is at all typical, you've probably been sitting for awhile. Take a few minutes to stretch before your next task?
It's lunchtime & your body deserves a break. Can you take a lap around this floor of your office building before you eat?
It's lunchtime & your body deserves a break. Can you take a lap around this floor of your office building after you eat?
You don't have to walk long or far to reap benefits. Even a 5-minute walk will stretch your muscles and get your blood flowing!
How about doing 100 jumping jacks tonight? They don't have to be all at once. Start with 25 now & do more throughout the evening!
How about doing 100 jumping jacks tonight? They don't have to be all at once. Start with 25 now & do more throughout the day!
Taking the bus this AM? How about walking to a stop a few blocks away? It's great to get the blood flowing before a busy day.
A clean living space & a healthy body? Sure! Can you spend 5 minutes, right now, tidying your home?
A clean living space & a healthy body? Sure! Can you spend 5 minutes, right now, tidying your office or workspace?
Did you know that walking helps you sleep longer & sounder at night? Sleep better tonight by going for a 15-minute brisk walk.
Driving to work? Could you park a block or two further away than normal, or in a 'less convenient' part of the parking lot?
If you take a brisk walk now, how will you feel for the rest of the day? (Spoiler alert: More energized!)
A "fit buddy" is a great way to hold yourself accountable. Can you ask coworkers or friends if they'd take a walk with you this morning?
A "fit buddy" is a great way to hold yourself accountable. Can you ask coworkers or friends if they'd take a walk with you this afternoon?
How could you add activity to this morning's commute? Get off the bus a stop early? Park farther away from your office building?
Why not get to work a little early & take a stroll through the office before your co-workers arrive? Great way to start your day!
It's hard to take breaks when you're being productive, isn't it? Remember: walks improve energy & stamina. Play the long game & fit in a 10 minute walk now!
Your eyes need a break, too! Try standing up for 30 seconds & looking away from your computer. Maybe stretch your neck & back?
Try injecting some energy into your weekend housework this morning: do bicep curls with the laundry detergent or push-ups against the counter!
Try injecting some energy into your weekend housework this evening: do bicep curls with the laundry detergent or push-ups against the counter!
Try injecting some energy into your weeknight housework: do bicep curls with the laundry detergent or push-ups against the counter!
Dinnertime! Instead of using the dishwasher afterwards, why not wash your dishes by hand? Aim for 50 calf-raises while you scrub.
Don't let the snow stop you! Why don't you stop at the mall, gym, or superstore on the way to work and get in a quick 2000 steps?
Don't think about the snow this evening - think about your health! Can you power through a 15-minute walk right now?
How about taking a few minutes to enjoy nature? Head outside & walk until you see a wild animal (even if it's just a squirrel...)
Our bodies are made to move! Even 3 minutes of walking around your building can make a difference. Can you take a 3-minute break?
Change up your movement! How about doing some walking lunges around your desk? It will stretch your legs & raise your heart rate!
When is inefficiency good? When it means more steps! This morning, try to choose a printer farther away or use a restroom on a different floor.
When is inefficiency good? When it means more steps! This afternoon, try to choose a printer farther away or use a restroom on a different floor.
Have an errand to do before heading home? If you’re driving, try parking at the very back of the lot to get a few extra steps in.
Have errands to do this afternoon? If you’re driving, try parking at the very back of the lot to get a few extra steps in.
Need a little afternoon pick-me-up? A brisk walk around the office will get energy flowing. Smile at your coworkers for extra good vibes!
Is now a good time for a stroll through the office? Maybe say hello to your colleague at the far end that you rarely see anymore?
Every 30 minutes of walking can add 60 minutes to your life expectancy! Let's earn an extra hour now with a brisk 30-minute walk!
Did you know race-walking has been an Olympic sport for 90+ years? Find out if it's your calling by heading out for a brisk walk right now!
Weekends are a great time to explore local museums & galleries! Meandering through the exhibits is a great way to rack up steps.
An awesome day is ahead. What's your plan for getting more steps today? Parking farther away? Getting off the bus a stop early?
Enjoying a night in? You deserve it! Can you make it healthful for your mind & body by taking breaks to walk from room to room?
Enjoying a night in? You deserve it! Take care of mind & body by taking a break to stretch every half hour.
How about a 15-minute walk outside? Enjoy the colors of nature and get some fresh air!
Lunch is the perfect time to get in a workout! The weather isn't great, but maybe you could spend 15 minutes walking the stairs or hallways?
Lunch is the perfect time to get in a workout! Could spend 15 minutes walking the stairs or hallways?
Do you have a one-on-one meeting today? Could you convince the person to walk while you meet? Around hallways, up & down stairs...
Surprise a friend by taking him or her out for lunch! Is there a restaurant within walking distance of one of your offices?
How much time have you spent sitting today? Could you recharge your body by standing up and stretching your arms to the ceiling?
So the weather outside is frightful - but it's always 68 & sunny at the mall! How about taking a stroll through the galleria?
Even though the weather isn't looking so great, why don't you grab some gloves and take a relaxing walk? Breathe the crisp air!
Could you take the stairs this afternoon? Even those few extra steps will ensure that you feel great when you head home for the evening.
Just about time to head home? Kickstart your evening by taking the stairs on your way out.
What a great morning! How about taking fifteen minutes for a brisk walk before heading to work to rev up your body for the day?
Weekends are great for shopping! Could you walk (instead of drive!) to the nearest supermarket or store to find a deal or two?
From raking leaves to mowing the lawn, yard-work is a great form of exercise! Spend 10 minutes outside - any weeds to be pulled?
From raking leaves to mowing the lawn, yardwork is a great form of exercise! Spend 10 minutes outside - any weeds to be pulled?
You know that coworker on the other side of the building? The one you haven't seen in ages? We bet they miss you! Why don’t you walk over and say hello?
Sometimes the best stretches are the simplest: For a full-body stretch, stand up, plant your feet & reach your arms up & back.
Start building that step count! Is there a longer route you can take from your house to the bus/car, or into your office building this morning?
Walking can improve your health--rain, snow or shine! Lace up those snow boots & head out for a 10-15 minute stroll right now?
You know what’s awesome? The sunset! How about looking up tonight's sunset time & heading out for a walk to check it out?
How much more productive would you feel for the rest of the day if you took a 10 minute walk now?
Rough day at work? Sometimes you just need to dance it out. Waltz? Line dance? Do the robot? We'll leave the style up to you.
The hidden benefit of housework: it's great for staying active! What needs fixing, vacuuming, dusting or organizing right now?
The hidden benefit of housework: it's great for staying active! What needs fixing, vacuuming, dusting or organizing right now?
This would be a great evening to take a long walk. Channel your inner Ansel Adams: bring a camera & take pictures of the snow!
This would be a great evening to take a long walk. Channel your inner Ansel Adams: bring a camera & snap some nature pics!
Facts: (1) The weather isn't too bad; (2) A short walk would energize your evening. Proceed at your leisure.
We know it can be hard to stop working and take a walking break. But remember: a short walk now could mean more productivity later!
So our intel says it's nice enough for a walk outside. Confirm we're right by heading out for a 10-15 min stroll (or at least a quick walk to the window!).
Scientific studies show that walking more leads to better sleep. Help yourself sleep by taking a few more steps right now!
Running doesn't have to be intimidating--just start slow. On today's walk, try a light jog for just 3 minutes. You can do it!
Running doesn't have to be intimidating--just start slow. On today's walk, try a light jog for just 3 minutes. You can do it!
How about asking your friend or neighbor to go for a walk? Evening walks are a great way to share stories, laugh, & reflect.
How about asking your friend or neighbor to go for a walk? Weekend walks are a great way to share stories, laugh, & reflect.
Get your creative energy flowing! A walk before work could be the perfect start to your day. Can you manage one this morning?
Quick, look at the clock! If the minute ends in an odd number, try to remain standing for the next 5 minutes.
Quick, look at the clock! If the minute ends in an even number, try to stay moving for the next 4 minutes.
It's lunchtime! Reenergize your body and your brain with a quick walk around your building before you dig in.
It's lunchtime! Reenergize your body and your brain with a quick walk around block before you dig in.
A quick walk to the end of the street and back will get your blood pumping! You can do it now - it'll only take five minutes!
Running low on milk? Why not go to a local supermarket & walk a couple of laps through the aisles while you fill your basket?
Have you been staring at a screen all day? Give your eyes a break by walking a lap around this floor of your office building.
How about using the treadmill while you watch TV tonight? No treadmill? How about walking in place during commercial breaks?
How could you be active this weekend? How about wandering through some local garage sales or checking out a farmers' market?
Can you jump up & walk to the end of the hall & back? It's a quick way to get a few steps & re-focus for the rest of the day!
Are your windows looking a bit grimy? Grab a rag & wipe in big circles to work your arms & get those windows squeaky-clean!
Do you have a few free minutes right now? How about googling "free workout videos" & trying out the first one that pops up?
Do you have a few free minutes right now? How about googling "free workout videos" & trying out the first one that pops up?
Could you take a lap around your office floor or building before heading to your desk? Be kind to your body before a long stretch of sitting.
The morning is a great time to be active. How about a walk around the outside of your building before settling in at your desk?
Hey you! Have you been sitting for a while? Can you take a 5 minute walking break?
Hey you! Have you been sitting for a while? How about standing up & stretching your legs?
We know the snow's not always fun, but health maintenance shouldn't take a holiday! Grab some gloves & brave a frosty walk!
Have you been sitting all morning? Why not stand up & do some light stretches for 2-3 minutes? It will energize you for the rest of the day!
"If I could not walk far and fast, I think I should just explode and perish." ― Charles Dickens. Where will you walk today?
It's not too late! Do you have time to take a friend or family member for a walk in the park this evening? It's a great way to connect.
It's not too late! Do you have time to take a friend or family member for a walk in the park this weekend? It's a great way to connect.
It's a great time for a walk around the block! Too busy or tired? Stop and think about the whole-body benefits of moving!
Moderate sun exposure is good for you - just don't forget your SPF! Can you take a short walk outside to soak up those rays?
Taking a short stroll after lunch can really help your digestion! Are you able to fit in 10 minutes of movement right now?
Moderate sun exposure is good for you - just don't forget your SPF! Can you take a short walk outside to soak up those rays?
Stuck inside? What could you do indoors to move around? Is dancing out of the question? (Maybe close the curtains first!)
Wouldn't today be a great day to enjoy the outdoors? How about checking out a nearby park with a friend or family member?
Hey, you're pretty tough! Do you think you can take a brisk 15-min walk before heading to work to rev up your body for the day?
Watching TV tonight? Whether football or a reality show, maybe you could try some jumping jacks or crunches during commercials?
Before heading into the office today, what if you took a lap around your block? The fresh, crisp air will clear your mind!
Taking the stairs at the office will ensure that you feel great all day long. How about you climbing a flight or two now?
"Now shall I walk or shall I ride? 'Ride,' Pleasure said; 'Walk,' Joy replied." ― W.H. Davies. Where will you walk today?
After sitting all day at work, why not get up and do some light stretches? It will invigorate you for the evening ahead.
Need a coffee or tea break? Instead of using the office coffeemaker, why not walk to a nearby cafe & order a to-go cup?
How about taking a break & going for a walk outside to clear your head? You'll be more productive when you come back in!
How often do you get to enjoy a peaceful afternoon? Can you take a quick ten-minute walk to stretch your legs and mind?
Wouldn't it feel great to take a stroll around the neighborhood on a night like this? Do you have 15 minutes right now?
Favorite show on tonight? Try walking around your house or apartment during commercials to interrupt the sitting cycle.
Sometimes your body talks; sometimes your body screams! What does it need right now? Maybe a few minutes of stretching?
Morning jumpstart: Why not go to work a little early & make a few laps around the office before your colleagues arrive?
Spent a lot of time sitting today? When you get home, you could stretch your body back out by walking to a nearby park.
Intra-office communication is important. How about walking to a coworker's desk & asking for some work-related advice?
Weekend mornings are so full of possibility! Could you start your day off right with a walk around your neighborhood?
Since the weather doesn't look great, why don't you step on the treadmill or walk in place while you watch TV tonight?
The weather may look bad, but a little snow never hurt anybody. How about a nice, fresh walk before the sun comes back?
Maybe today would be a great day to explore outdoors? How about fitting in a quick walk over lunch?
Good morning! When you get to work, try stretching your legs for a minute or two before sitting down at your desk.
Good morning! When you get to work, how about going for a 5-10 minute walk before settling in at your desk?
It's a great day to hit the park--how about ice skating or snowshoeing or a good old-fashioned snowball fight?
Ready for some hoops? How about standing up and throwing some used paper balls in your office trash or recycling bin?
What if you walked home from work today? It's a great way to increase your step count & decompress after a busy day.
Did you know that walking boosts memory & your ability to learn? Increase your daily step count & we bet you won't forget!
Have you been sitting all day? If you can, try not to sit all night too! Maybe tackle some active housework, like cooking or vacuuming?
How about spending your weekend afternoon taking a walk through a nearby park? It'd be a great way to enjoy the day.
What about a walk around the block after dinner, or between dinner & dessert? Give your body the movement it needs.
How’s your step count progressing today? A 10-minute walk around the block this evening could add hundreds of steps!
You're more productive when you're comfortable! Try 10 forward & 10 backward shoulder rolls to release some tension.
Feeling stuck on a problem? That can be frustrating. Why not walk around the office for 5 minutes & mull it over?
All walks (even indoors!) can help with energy & focus. Can you spare 10 minutes for a few laps around the office?
What can you do to increase your activity level today? Find a gym buddy? Try a new activity? Run some extra errands?
Where's the most beautiful spot in your town? Could you walk or bike there? Or drive, but then get out of your car & explore!
Feeling stiff? Try standing up & reaching down to touch your toes. It might look silly, but we bet it feels good!
Is there a healthy restaurant near your home? Instead of ordering in, how about walking or biking there for dinner?
Wouldn't it be great to take advantage of the lovely evening by going for a walk? Clear your mind & move your body!
A quick walk to the end of the street and back will energize you! You can do it now - it'll only take 5 minutes!
A quick walk to the end of the street and back will energize you! You can do it now - it'll only take 5 minutes!
Can you add steps to today's chores? Put dishes away one at a time, or add extra steps when walking from room to room.
Can you add steps to this weekend's chores? Put dishes away one at a time, or add extra steps when walking from room to room.
Are you running errands today? Add steps by taking an extra lap around the store or parking in a spot further away.
Running errands on your way home tonight? Add steps by taking an extra lap around the store or parking in a spot further away.
A short jaunt through the neighborhood this morning would be a great way to start the day. Can you make it happen?
It's time to grab your walking shoes! Can you think of anyone who would join you for a stroll? Try to fit in 15-20 minutes, solo or in tandem!
Can you take a detour & fit in 500 steps before your next task? Give yourself some energy for the rest of the day!
Maybe you'd enjoy a 15-20 minute stroll outside this evening? Our data indicate you might (though we have been wrong before...)
We understand if you want to stay inside today. Why not do some push-ups & jumping jacks while watching TV?
We understand if you want to stay inside this evening. How about doing jumping jacks or lunges while watching TV?
Now's the perfect time for some fresh air! If you don't feel like eating outside, maybe you could fit a 10-minute walk into your lunch break?
Workin' for the weekend? Make sure you're working OUT for the weekend, too! Can you fit in a 5-10 minute walk now?
Need to brainstorm project ideas with a coworker today? Ask him or her to walk while the two of you discuss ideas.
Have you always wanted to learn to swing dance or rumba? Find a beginner instructional video online & dance away!
Have you always wanted to learn to swing dance or rumba? Find a beginner instructional video online & dance away!
Feeling tired? A walk could be just what you need. Chat with a friend or family member on a walk around the neighborhood this evening.
Feeling tired? A walk could be just what you need. Chat with a friend or family member on a walk around the neighborhood.
Busy day? Well done in making it through. A 15-20 minute walk before bed can be a great way to decompress.
Quick, let's stretch! Stand up, reeeeach for the sky, reeeeach for your toes, and repeat! Feels good, doesn't it?
Is there anything you've been meaning to bring from upstairs to ground level or vice versa? You could get it now!
Is there anything you've been meaning to bring from upstairs to ground level or vice versa? You could get it now!
Bad day? Good day? Either way--we bet you'll feel better after a 10-15 minute walk! Where can you head right now?
Aren't afternoon strolls romantic!? No? How about energizing then? Can you try one out for 15 minutes & let us know?
If you have to use the elevator today, why not get off a few floors below your target & walk the rest of the way up or down?
Weekends are a great time to exercise. Right now, could you head to the park to shoot some hoops or walk a mile or two?
Can you see the stars from where you live? Why don't you head out for a relaxing, star-gazing walk tonight?
Out on the town tonight? Can you see the stars? How about fitting in a 15-minute star-gazing walk before heading home?
